analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yi ge lnga po bhr'um aom dzr'im kham h'um rnams byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam par yab kyi zhal nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung ste /
translated: The five syllables—bhrūṃ, oṃ, jrīṃ, khaṃ, hūṃ—in the form of bodhicitta emerge from the father’s mouth through the path of his vajra.

original: thig le brgyad du gyur nas padma 'phro ba'i dus su sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thig le brgyad du gyur nas padma 'phro ba'i dus su sngags 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: They become eight bindus, and when they enter the lotus, one should recite this mantra:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'a tma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sv'a bh'a ba a'a tma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ, all tathāgatas, the vajra nature of passion is my very self.

analyzed: thig le brgyad las gam tsam bam gham pam sham lam dam sa bon de dag las phyag g-yas kyi phyag mtshan brgyad du gyur /
translated: From the eight bindus, the eight seed syllables gaṃ caṃ vaṃ śaṃ laṃ daṃ saṃ arise, and from those, the eight hand implements of the right hands arise.

original: de dag las lha mo brgyad du gyur te /
analyzed: de dag las lha mo brgyad du gyur te /
translated: From those, the eight goddesses arise.

original: goo r'i nag mo g-yas na gri gug g-yon na nya bsnams pa /
analyzed: goo r'i nag mo g-yas na gri gug g-yon na nya bsnams pa /

original: shar phyogs su tshangs pa'i steng du gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: shar phyogs su tshangs pa'i steng du gdon par bya ste /
translated: She should be placed in the east, on Brahmā.

analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs su chom rkun ma btsod kyi kha dog can phyag g-yas na cang te'u g-yon na phag pa can dbang po'i steng du'o //
translated: Likewise, in the south, Caṇḍālī is the color of vermilion, holding a ḍamaru in her right hand and a pig in her left hand, on Indra.

original: ro langs ma dmar ser gser bsregs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yas na rus sbal g-yon na thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: ro langs ma dmar ser gser bsregs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yas na rus sbal g-yon na thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: Pukkasi is orange, the color of burnt gold, holding a tortoise in her right hand and a skull cup in her left hand.

original: nub phyogs su nye dbang gi steng du'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs su nye dbang gi steng du'o //
translated: She is in the west, on Viṣṇu.

original: za phod ma kha dog ljang gu phyag g-yas na sbrul g-yon na thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: za phod ma kha dog ljang gu phyag g-yas na sbrul g-yon na thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: Ghasmarī is green, holding a snake in her right hand and a skull cup in her left hand.

original: byang phyogs su drag po'i steng du'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su drag po'i steng du'o //
translated: She is in the north, on Rudra.

original: pukka s'i kha dog sngon mo phyag g-yas na seng ge g-yon na dgra sta bsnams pa /
analyzed: pukka s'i kha dog sngon mo phyag g-yas na seng ge g-yon na dgra sta bsnams pa /
translated: Pukkasi is blue, holding a lion in her right hand and a sword in her left.

original: byang shar gyi mtshams na gshin rje'i steng du'o //
analyzed: byang shar gyi mtshams na gshin rje'i steng du'o //
translated: She is in the northeast corner, on Yama.

analyzed: ri khrod ma sku mdog dkar mo phyag g-yas na dge slong g-yon na gsil byed bsnams pa /
translated: Chaundra is white, holding a bhiksu in her right hand and a mendicant's staff in her left.

original: shar lho'i mtshams su nor sbyin gyis steng du'o //
analyzed: shar lho'i mtshams su nor sbyin gyis steng du'o //
translated: She is in the southeast corner, on Kubera.

analyzed: gtum mo nam mkha'i kha dog can phyag g-yas na 'khor lo /

translated: and a skull cup in her left.

original: lho nub kyi mtshams su bden bral gyi steng du'o //
analyzed: lho nub kyi mtshams su bden bral gyi steng du'o //
translated: She is in the southwest corner, on Varuna.

analyzed: g-yung mo sna tshogs pa'i mdog can phyag g-yas na rdo rje g-yon na sdigs mdzub dang ldan pa nub byang mtshams su thags bzangs ris kyi steng du gdon par bya'o //
translated: Ghasmari is multicolored, holding a vajra in her right hand and a threatening forefinger in her left. She should be placed in the northwest corner, on Dhritarashtra.

original: lha mo de dag skyil krung phyed pa gar gyis gnas pa /
analyzed: lha mo de dag skyil krung phyed pa gar gyis gnas pa /
translated: All these goddesses are in half-dance posture.

original: spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa'o //
translated: They have three eyes and are adorned with the five symbolic ornaments.

original: de nas @150a * //
analyzed: de nas @150a * //
translated: Then,

analyzed: yab yum gyi rol pa'i sgras bskul bas srid pa bar ma'i bag chags kyis yi ge lnga po ho //
translated: The sound of the play of the father and mother invokes the latent tendencies of the intermediate existence, and the five syllables are the five aggregates.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho: rnams zhal nas zhugs te /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho: rnams zhal nas zhugs te /
translated: The five syllables—oṃ, āḥ, hūṃ, hoḥ, and ha—enter the mouths of the father and mother.

analyzed: padmar phyin pa tsam gyis yab yum gnyis 'od kyi gong bur gyur pa la /
translated: The moment they arrive at the lotus, both father and mother become a ball of light.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyis glus skul bar byed de /
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyis glus skul bar byed de /
translated: The goddesses in the intermediate directions invoke them with songs:

analyzed: snying rje'i thugs kyis rje btsun bzhengs //
translated: “Arise, O venerable one, with a compassionate mind.

original: pukka s'i ni bdag skyabs mdzod //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni bdag skyabs mdzod //
translated: O Pukkasī, please protect me.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas ni //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the nature of emptiness,

original: bdag la bde chen rnal 'byor sbyor //
analyzed: bdag la bde chen rnal 'byor sbyor //
translated: unite me with the yoga of great bliss.

original: khyod dang bral na bdag 'gum pas //
analyzed: khyod dang bral na bdag 'gum pas //
translated: Since I will die without you,🔽O Hevajra, please arise.

original: kye yi rdo rje khyod bzhengs shig / stong ba'i rang bzhin spongs mdzod la //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje khyod bzhengs shig / stong ba'i rang bzhin spongs mdzod la //
translated: Abandon the nature of emptiness,

original: ri khrod ma ni bdag don sgrub //
analyzed: ri khrod ma ni bdag don sgrub //
translated: O Caurī, accomplish my purpose.

original: 'jig rten mgron gnyer 'dod pa'i gtso //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgron gnyer 'dod pa'i gtso //
translated: O chief of those who desire to serve the guests of the world,

original: stong pa nyid la ci phyir bzhugs //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ci phyir bzhugs //
translated: why do you remain in emptiness?

original: gtum mo bdag ni zhu ba bgyid //
analyzed: gtum mo bdag ni zhu ba bgyid //
translated: O Caṇḍālī, I am your supplicant.

original: khyod ma langs na phyogs mi 'tshal //
analyzed: khyod ma langs na phyogs mi 'tshal //
translated: If you do not arise, I will not know what to do.

original: bdag gis nyid kyi thugs 'tshal gyi //
analyzed: bdag gis nyid kyi thugs 'tshal gyi //
translated: I know your mind.🔽You, O lord of the senses, arise!

original: dbang po'i dran ldan khyod bzhengs shig / g-yung mo bdag ni dran nyams pas //
analyzed: dbang po'i dran ldan khyod bzhengs shig / g-yung mo bdag ni dran nyams pas //
translated: I, the Yoginī, have lost my memory.🔽Do not interrupt your compassion.

original: thugs rjes rgyun chad ma mdzad cig / de ltar bskul bas sngon gyi smon lam rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: thugs rjes rgyun chad ma mdzad cig / de ltar bskul bas sngon gyi smon lam rjes su dran nas /
translated: Thus, by this urging, he remembers his former aspiration,

original: khu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni gong du smos pa lta bu la /
analyzed: khu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni gong du smos pa lta bu la /
translated: and arises from the form of the seminal essence, as described above.

original: sku mdog gnag pa g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba //
analyzed: sku mdog gnag pa g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba //
translated: His body is black, the right side white, the left side red,

original: zhabs phyed krung du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zhabs phyed krung du bzhugs pa /
translated: he sits in half-lotus posture,

original: mgo bo'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng ba'i do shal can /
translated: has a garland of heads,

original: sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and holds a crossed vajra on his crown.

original: de nas snying gar pam las padma /
analyzed: de nas snying gar pam las padma /
translated: Then, in his heart, from paṃ, a lotus;

original: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i steng du ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: on that, from raṃ, a sun maṇḍala;

original: de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje /
translated: on that, from hūṃ, a vajra.

original: de las rang dang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa'/
analyzed: de las rang dang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa'/
translated: From that, a gnosis-being like oneself arises.

original: de'i thugs kar yang padma dang nyi ma dang h'um las rdo rje /
analyzed: de'i thugs kar yang padma dang nyi ma dang h'um las rdo rje /
translated: In its heart, also, from paṃ, a lotus; from raṃ, a sun; and from hūṃ, a vajra.

original: de'i lte ba la h'um bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la h'um bsam par bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should imagine hūṃ.

original: de nas aom badzra goo r'i a'a karsha ya dza: zhes brjod pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas aom badzra goo r'i a'a karsha ya dza: zhes brjod pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs te /
translated: Then, saying Oṃ vajra-gouri ākarṣaya jaḥ, invite the awareness wheel into the space in front.

original: phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod la /
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod la /
translated: Make offerings with outer, inner, and secret offerings.

original: aom badzra tsoo r'i pra be sha ya h'um /🔽zhes brjod pas gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra tsoo r'i pra be sha ya h'um / zhes brjod pas gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Say Oṃ vajra-cchouri praveśaya hūṃ, and they enter.

original: aom badzra be t'a l'i spho ta ya bam zhes brjod pas bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra be t'a l'i spho ta ya bam zhes brjod pas bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Say Oṃ vajra-vetālī sphicaya vaṃ, and they are bound.

original: aom badzra ghasma r'i wa sham ku ru ho: zhes brjod pas dgyes pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ghasma r'i wa sham ku ru ho: zhes brjod pas dgyes pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Say Oṃ vajra-ghaṇṭā vaśaṃ kuru hoḥ, and they are delighted.

analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyis bstims pa la skye mched byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: In that way, the awareness beings are absorbed, and you should consecrate the sense fields.

translated: Mohavajrā, Rāgavajrā, Irsya-vajrā, and Nairātma-yoginī are generated from the first letters of their names, maṃ, daṃ, raṃ, saṃ, and naṃ, in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis sna tshogs mdog can phyag g-yas na gri gug g-yon na thod pa ro'i gdan can no //

analyzed: aom a'a: h'um gsum las mkha' spyod ma dang sa spyod ma dang sa 'og ma gsum dkar ba dang dmar ba dang gnag pa'o //

original: lha mo sku yi rigs las byung //
analyzed: lha mo sku yi rigs las byung //

original: rnal 'byor ma ni mkha' spyod ma //

analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta batt'a l'i badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //

analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer lcags kyu lta bus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs te /
translated: Then light rays in the form of hooks from the seed syllable in one’s heart invite all the buddhas of the ten directions.

analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyi mchod pas mchod la dbang bskur ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: Make offerings with the outer, inner, and secret offerings and take the empowerment conferral.

original: bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs pa rnams //
analyzed: bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs pa rnams //
translated: Bhagavat, tathāgatas,🔽please empower me, O protectors.

analyzed: ro langs ma dang gtum mo ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //

analyzed: aom sarba ta t'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa mri ta sva da na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko nyham /
